alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 5:44AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southern Laurel, Knox, southeastern Pulaski, northeastern McCreary and northern Whitley Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 543 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Victory, or 12 miles southeast of Somerset, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Huxley and Rockcastle Springs around 550 AM EDT. Bark Camp, Holly Bay Rec. Area and Baldrock around 555 AM EDT. Grove, Rye, Vox, Deering, Keavy, Youngs Creek and Hightop around 600 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barton, Faber, North Corbin, Dorthae, Walden, Lily, Woodbine, Moore Hill, Wilton, Rockholds, Lynn Camp, McHargue, Arkle, Rossland, Indian Creek, Bertha Station, Gray, Emmanuel, Lowell, Dishman Springs, Bentley Station, Baileys Switch, Garrich, Swan Lake, Jarvis, Permon, King, Barbourville, Heidrick, Yeager, Boone Heights, Bimble, Artemus, Cannon, Brush Creek, Hinkle and Swanpond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley
